text:
When recording an asp.net application the application maintatins state using a
parmeter __VIEWSTATE.  When the browser (IE in this case) sends this parameter
to the server it is URL encoded (confirmed via a network protocol monitor)
however if the session is recorded via the Jmeter proxy, the parameter value is
not URL encoded when displayed in the HTTP Request element.  Even though the
Encode option is checked, Jmeter delivers the parameter to the application
un-encoded ( also confirmed via a network protocol monitor).  The asp.net
application then throws a corrupted state exception.

This seems to only be a problem for http-upload transactions as POST operations
recoded earlier in the script have the __VIEWSTATE parameter correctly encoded
in the HTTP Request element and deliver the parameter encoded to the application.
creator: eric.shoemaker@gmail.com
alf@i100.no
text:
I think this bug should be closed as "Fixed".

As the bug states, the problem appeared in file upload, i.e. multipart/form-data
HTTP Post requests.
In bug 41837 a problem in HTTP Proxy server's handling of multipart/form-data
was fixed. The problem was that the code incorrectly assumed that values of a
multipart/form-data was urlencoded, which it is not.

I have testet the latest code in SVN, and the values of __VIEWSTATE is sent
correctly by the proxy, and by the sampler put into the test plan.

So this is really a duplicate of 41837.
